cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest today, expected to bend west then northwest and approach the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast between the Mouth of the Mississippi River and Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch and Storm-Surge Watch in effect from the Mouth of the Mississippi River / Pearl River westward to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from the Mississippi/Alabama border westward to the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: SHREVEPORT LA (closest listed point to MO, ~275 mi S of the port)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (20-30 mph gusts) late Sunday into Monday as the remnant low tracks near Missouri
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy showers possible, most guidance keeps totals 1â€“3 inches over northwest Missouri
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized urban or river flooding of smaller streams could disrupt terminal truck and rail access
